mn116:3.2.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, pañca paccekabuddhasatāni imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsino ahesuṁ.
mn116:3.2.en: Once upon a time, five hundred Buddhas awakened for themselves dwelt for a long time on this Isigili.

mn116:3.7.en: I shall declare the names of the Buddhas awakened for themselves;

mn116:3.8.en: I shall extol the names of the Buddhas awakened for themselves;

mn116:3.9.en: I shall teach the names of the Buddhas awakened for themselves.

mn116:4.1.pli: “Ariṭṭho nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
mn116:4.1.en: “The Buddhas awakened for themselves who dwelt for a long time on this Isigili were named Ariṭṭha,

mn116:6.3.en: awakened for themselves, enders of the conduit to rebirth.

mn116:7.1.en: These and other mighty ones awakened for themselves,

dn16:5.12.3.pli: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho, paccekasambuddho thūpāraho, tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho, rājā cakkavattī thūpārahoti.
dn16:5.12.3.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; a Buddha awakened for themselves; a disciple of a Realized One; and a wheel-turning monarch.

dn16:5.12.8.en: And for what reason is a Buddha awakened for themselves worthy of a monument?

dn16:5.12.9.pli: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato paccekasambuddhassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
dn16:5.12.9.en: So that many people will inspire confidence in their hearts, thinking: ‘This is the monument for that Buddha awakened for themselves!’

dn16:5.12.11.pli: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca paccekasambuddho thūpāraho.
dn16:5.12.11.en: It is for this reason that a Buddha awakened for themselves is worthy of a monument.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 16
The Great Discourse on the Buddha’s Extinguishment

an9.20:8.3.pli: yo ca sataṁ arahantānaṁ bhojeyya, yo cekaṁ paccekabuddhaṁ bhojeyya …pe…
an9.20:8.3.en: It would be more fruitful to feed one Buddha awakened for themselves than a hundred perfected ones.

an9.20:8.4.pli: yo ca sataṁ paccekabuddhānaṁ bhojeyya, yo ca tathāgataṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ bhojeyya …pe…
an9.20:8.4.en: It would be more fruitful to feed one Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha than a hundred Buddhas awakened for themselves.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 9.20
2. The Lion’s Roar
About Velāma

mn142:5.5.en: One gives a gift to a Buddha awakened for themselves.

mn142:6.1.pli: Tatrānanda, tiracchānagate dānaṁ datvā sataguṇā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, puthujjanadussīle dānaṁ datvā sahassaguṇā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, puthujjanasīlavante dānaṁ datvā satasahassaguṇā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, bāhirake kāmesu vītarāge dānaṁ datvā koṭisatasahassaguṇā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanne dānaṁ datvā asaṅkheyyā appameyyā dakkhiṇā pāṭikaṅkhitabbā, ko pana vādo sotāpanne, ko pana vādo sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanne, ko pana vādo sakadāgāmissa, ko pana vādo anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanne, ko pana vādo anāgāmissa, ko pana vādo arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanne, ko pana vādo arahante, ko pana vādo paccekasambuddhe, ko pana vādo tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe.
mn142:6.1.en: Now, Ānanda, gifts to the following persons may be expected to yield the following returns. To an animal, a hundred times. To an unethical ordinary person, a thousand. To an ethical ordinary person, a hundred thousand. To an outsider free of sensual desire, 10,000,000,000. But a gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry may be expected to yield incalculable, immeasurable returns. How much more so a gift to a stream-enterer, someone practicing to realize the fruit of once-return, a once-returner, someone practicing to realize the fruit of non-return, a non-returner, someone practicing to realize the fruit of perfection, a perfected one, or a Buddha awakened for themselves? How much more so a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha?

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 142
The Analysis of Religious Donations

an4.247:1.3.pli: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho, paccekabuddho thūpāraho, tathāgatasāvako thūpāraho, rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho—
an4.247:1.3.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; a Buddha awakened for themselves; a disciple of a Realized One; and a wheel-turning monarch.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4.247
25. Perils of Offenses
Worthy of a Monument

an10.16:1.3.pli: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, paccekabuddho, ubhatobhāgavimutto, paññāvimutto, kāyasakkhī, diṭṭhippatto, saddhāvimutto, saddhānusārī, dhammānusārī, gotrabhū—
an10.16:1.3.en: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; a Buddha awakened for themselves; one freed both ways; one freed by wisdom; a personal witness; one attained to view; one freed by faith; a follower by faith; a follower of the teachings; a member of the spiritual family.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.16
2. A Protector
Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods

sn3.20:3.2.pli: Bhūtapubbaṁ so, mahārāja, seṭṭhi gahapati taggarasikhiṁ nāma paccekasambuddhaṁ piṇḍapātena paṭipādesi.
sn3.20:3.2.en: Once upon a time, great king, that financier householder provided almsfood on behalf of a Buddha awakened for themselves named Tagarasikhī.

ud5.3:11.2.pli: So uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto addasa tagarasikhiṁ paccekabuddhaṁ nagaraṁ piṇḍāya pavisantaṁ.
ud5.3:11.2.en: On his way to visit a park, he saw Tagarasikhī, a Buddha awakened for themselves, entering the city for alms.

mlDocs.title:
Heartfelt Sayings 5.3
With Suppabuddha the Leper

kp8:15.3.en: the plane of a Buddha awakened for themselves:

an2.56:1.3.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, paccekabuddho ca.
an2.56:1.3.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the Buddha awakened for themselves.
